body_content.explanation: the condition of being or becoming very poor, or the act of making someone very poor:
examples: The drought reduced many farmers to impoverishment.
Progress has meant continued impoverishment and a growing contrast between the wealth of the few and the poverty of the many.

body_content.explanation: the act or result of making something weaker or worse in quality:
examples: The overuse of chemical fertilizers has caused impoverishment of the soil.
All too often these attempts have resulted in an impoverishment of the subject.
